Properties.ProtectedString:
Tool = script.Parent
local stillEquipped = false
function onEquippedLocal(mouse) stillEquipped = true if mouse == nil then print("Mouse not found") return end while stillEquipped do print("Setting Mouse to go") mouse.Icon = "rbxasset://textures\\GunCursor.png" while Tool.Enabled and stillEquipped do wait(0.01) end print("Setting Mouse to wait") mouse.Icon = "rbxasset://textures\\GunWaitCursor.png" while not Tool.Enabled and stillEquipped do wait(0.01) end end end
function onUnequippedLocal() stillEquipped = false end
Tool.Equipped:connect(onEquippedLocal) Tool.Unequipped:connect(onUnequippedLocal)

math.randomseed(tick()) math.random()
local Tool = script.Parent local Bomb = Tool.Handle
local unequipTime = 0 local downTime local upTime local heldTime local mouseIsDown = false
local countdownSound
local pullbackAnim local throwAnim
local targetPoint local targetDir
local ThrowDir local ForceMag
local newProjectileScript
local cloneScript
local myCharacter local myHumanoid local RightArm local RightGrip local Torso
local Fuse = Instance.new("Part") Fuse.CanCollide = false Fuse.Locked = true Fuse.formFactor = 3 -- Custom Fuse.Size = Vector3.new(0.2, 0.2, 0.2) Fuse.Name = "Ninja Sticky Bomb Fuse" Fuse.CFrame = Bomb.CFrame + Vector3.new(0, 0, -1) Fuse.Transparency = 1.0
local FuseWeld = Instance.new("Weld") FuseWeld.Name = "Ninja Sticky Bomb Fuse Weld" FuseWeld.Part0 = Bomb FuseWeld.Part1 = Fuse FuseWeld.C1 = CFrame.new(0, -1, 0, 1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1, 0, -1, 0) -- The angle change is so that FuseFire appears to be coming UP from the bomb, -- rather than shooting to the side of it. local FuseFire = Instance.new("Fire") FuseFire.Size = 1 FuseFire.Heat = 2 FuseFire.Name = "Fuse Fire"
local Explosion = Instance.new("Explosion") Explosion.BlastRadius = 5 Explosion.BlastPressure = 1000000
local ExplosionSound = Tool:FindFirstChild("ExplosionSound") if ExplosionSound then ExplosionSound = ExplosionSound:Clone() ExplosionSound.Parent = Explosion end
local yellSound local yellSoundsArray = {Tool:FindFirstChild("Yell1"), Tool:FindFirstChild("Yell2")}
Tool.Enabled = true
function onLeftMouseDown() -- Standard checks myCharacter = Tool.Parent if not myCharacter then return end myHumanoid = myCharacter:FindFirstChild("Humanoid") RightArm = myCharacter:FindFirstChild("Right Arm") if not (myHumanoid and RightArm) then return end RightGrip = RightArm:FindFirstChild("RightGrip") if not RightGrip then return end if not (RightGrip.Part0 == Bomb or RightGrip.Part1 == Bomb) then return end
-- First check to make sure our values are ready to be passed to the serverside script; -- otherwise throwing the bomb won't work and we'll just blow ourselves up. ThrowDir = Tool:FindFirstChild("ThrowDir") ForceMag = Tool:FindFirstChild("ForceMag") ProjectileScript = Tool:FindFirstChild("ProjectileScript") if not (ThrowDir and ForceMag and ProjectileScript) then return end
-- As always, make sure we've made it through cooldown. if not Tool.Enabled then return end Tool.Enabled = false
mouseIsDown = true downTime = time() if Fuse then FuseFire.Heat = 2 FuseFire.Parent = Fuse end
countdownSound = Tool:FindFirstChild("FiveSecondCountdown") if countdownSound then countdownSound:Play() end pullbackAnim = myHumanoid:LoadAnimation(Tool.PullBack) if pullbackAnim then pullbackAnim:Play() end
for i = 1, 5 do FuseFire.Heat = i*6 wait(1) end
-- Explode ourselves if we've waited too long with the same bomb. if mouseIsDown and (time() - downTime > 4.9) and (downTime > unequipTime) then Explosion.Position = Bomb.Position Explosion.Parent = game.Workspace if ExplosionSound then ExplosionSound:Play() end yellSound = yellSoundsArray[math.random(1, 2)] if yellSound then yellSound:Play() end -- Just in case character doesn't die from explosion (ForceField on, perhaps?), -- make sure the tool is still usable afterwards. Bomb.Transparency = 1.0 wait(2.5) Bomb.Transparency = 0.0 Tool.Enabled = true end end
function onLeftMouseUp() -- Standard checks (again, in case our arm got blown off during the hold) myCharacter = Tool.Parent if not myCharacter then return end myHumanoid = myCharacter:FindFirstChild("Humanoid") Torso = myCharacter:FindFirstChild("Torso") RightArm = myCharacter:FindFirstChild("Right Arm") if not (myHumanoid and Torso and RightArm) then return end RightGrip = RightArm:FindFirstChild("RightGrip") if not RightGrip then return end if not (RightGrip.Part0 == Bomb or RightGrip.Part1 == Bomb) then return end
if not mouseIsDown then return end mouseIsDown = false
if pullbackAnim then pullbackAnim:Stop() end if countdownSound then countdownSound:Stop() end
throwAnim = myHumanoid:LoadAnimation(Tool.Throw) if throwAnim then throwAnim:Play() end
upTime = time() heldTime = upTime - downTime ForceMag.Value = math.sqrt(heldTime) * 400
targetPoint = myHumanoid.TargetPoint targetDir = (targetPoint - Bomb.Position).unit ThrowDir.Value = targetDir
wait(0.1) -- For the animation
local newProjectileScript = Tool.ProjectileScript:Clone() -- We know it's non-nil since we checked for that in onLeftMouseDown(). newProjectileScript.Parent = Tool newProjectileScript.Disabled = false
-- Make bomb invisible, so it seems to have really traveled out of our hands Bomb.Transparency = 1.0 if FuseFire then FuseFire.Parent = nil end -- Wait a while... wait(2.5) -- And set stuff back to normal. Bomb.Transparency = 0.0 Tool.Enabled = true
end
function onEquipped(mouse) -- Connect the mouse if mouse then mouse.Button1Down:connect(onLeftMouseDown) mouse.Button1Up:connect(onLeftMouseUp) end -- Set up the fuse Fuse.Parent = game.Workspace FuseWeld.Parent = game.Workspace FuseFire.Parent = nil -- for now. end
function onUnequipped() -- Record the time, for use in onLeftMouseDown unequipTime = time()
-- Delete/stop the stuff we added throughout the script FuseWeld.Parent = nil Fuse.Parent = nil FuseFire.Parent = nil
if countdownSound then countdownSound:Stop() end if pullbackAnim then pullbackAnim:Stop() end if throwAnim then throwAnim:Stop() end
Bomb.Transparency = 0.0
-- Make sure tool can still be enabled even if we unequipped it with mouse down. if mouseIsDown then Tool.Enabled = true mouseIsDown = false end end
Tool.Equipped:connect(onEquipped) Tool.Unequipped:connect(onUnequipped)

math.randomseed(tick()) math.random()
local Tool = script.Parent local OldBomb = Tool.Handle
local magnitude = Tool.ForceMag.Value -- These are guaranteed to exist since we checked for that in onLeftMouseDown local direction = Tool.ThrowDir.Value -- in StickyBomb LS.
local myCharacter = Tool.Parent if not myCharacter then script:Remove() end local Torso = myCharacter:FindFirstChild("Torso") if not Torso then script:Remove() end local LookVector = Torso.CFrame.lookVector.unit local potentialHumanoid local myHumanoid local myPlayer
local theta local phi local psi local randLookVec
local NewBomb = OldBomb:Clone() NewBomb.CFrame = Torso.CFrame + 1.5 * Vector3.new(-LookVector.Z, 1.3, LookVector.X) NewBomb.Shape = Enum.PartType.Ball NewBomb.Locked = true NewBomb.CanCollide = true NewBomb.Name = "Ninja Sticky Bomb" NewBomb.Parent = game.Workspace NewBomb.Transparency = 0.0
local Fuse = Instance.new("Part") Fuse.CanCollide = false Fuse.Locked = true Fuse.formFactor = 3 -- Custom Fuse.Size = Vector3.new(0.2, 0.2, 0.2) Fuse.Name = "Ninja Sticky Bomb Fuse" Fuse.CFrame = NewBomb.CFrame + Vector3.new(0, 0, -1) Fuse.Transparency = 1.0 Fuse.Parent = game.Workspace
local FuseWeld = Instance.new("Weld") FuseWeld.Name = "Ninja Sticky Bomb Fuse Weld" FuseWeld.Part0 = NewBomb FuseWeld.Part1 = Fuse FuseWeld.C1 = CFrame.new(0, -1, 0, 1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1, 0, -1, 0) -- The angle change is so that FuseFire appears to be coming UP from the bomb, FuseWeld.Parent = game.Workspace -- rather than shooting to the side of it.
local FuseFire = Instance.new("Fire") FuseFire.Size = 1 FuseFire.Heat = 1 FuseFire.Name = "Fuse Fire" FuseFire.Parent = Fuse
local BombWeld
local connection
local Force = Instance.new("BodyForce") Force.force = magnitude * (LookVector + Vector3.new(0, direction.Y + 0.5, 0)) Force.Parent = NewBomb
local Explosion = Instance.new("Explosion") Explosion.BlastRadius = 5 Explosion.BlastPressure = 1000000
local CountdownSound = Tool:FindFirstChild("FiveSecondCountdown") if CountdownSound then CountdownSound = CountdownSound:Clone() CountdownSound.Parent = NewBomb end
local ExplosionSound = Tool:FindFirstChild("ExplosionSound") if ExplosionSound then ExplosionSound = ExplosionSound:Clone() ExplosionSound.Parent = NewBomb ExplosionSound.PlayOnRemove = true end
local YellSoundsArray = {Tool:FindFirstChild("Yell1"), Tool:FindFirstChild("Yell2"), Tool:FindFirstChild("Yell3")} local randIndex local YellSound
function randomizeYellSound() randIndex = math.random(1, 3) YellSound = YellSoundsArray[randIndex] if YellSound then YellSound = YellSound:Clone() YellSound.Parent = NewBomb if randIndex ~= 3 then YellSound.PlayOnRemove = true end end end
randomizeYellSound()
---------------------------------
function tagHumanoid(humanoid, player) local CreatorTag = Instance.new("ObjectValue") CreatorTag.Name = "creator" CreatorTag.Value = Player CreatorTag.Parent = humanoid end
function untagHumanoid(humanoid) if not humanoid then return end local CreatorTag = humanoid:FindFirstChild("creator") if CreatorTag then CreatorTag:Remove() end end
function explode() if CountdownSound then CountdownSound:Play() end for i = 1, 8 do FuseFire.Heat = 3*i wait(0.5) end if randIndex == 3 and YellSound then YellSound:Play() end for i = 9, 10 do FuseFire.Heat = 3*i wait(0.5) end Explosion.Position = NewBomb.Position Explosion.Parent = game.Workspace NewBomb:Remove() end
function stick(hit) -- First make sure we're only sticking it to characters. if not hit.Parent then return end potentialHumanoid = hit.Parent:FindFirstChild("Humanoid") if not potentialHumanoid then if hit.Parent.ClassName == "Hat" then potentialHumanoid = hit.Parent.Parent:FindFirstChild("Humanoid") end end
myHumanoid = myCharacter:FindFirstChild("Humanoid")
if (potentialHumanoid and myHumanoid and potentialHumanoid ~= myHumanoid) then connection:disconnect() if Force then Force:Remove() end
BombWeld = Instance.new("Weld") BombWeld.Part0 = hit BombWeld.Part1 = NewBomb BombWeld.Name = "Ninja Sticky Bomb Weld" BombWeld.Parent = game.Workspace
theta = 2 * math.pi * math.random() phi = 2 * math.pi * math.random() psi = 2 * math.pi * math.random()
randLookVec = CFrame.Angles(theta, phi, psi).lookVector
if (hit.Name == "Torso" or hit.Name == "Head") then BombWeld.C1 = CFrame.new(Vector3.new(0, 0, 1), randLookVec) elseif (hit.Name == "Left Leg" or hit.Name == "Left Arm") then BombWeld.C1 = CFrame.new(Vector3.new(0.5, 0, 0), randLookVec) elseif (hit.Name == "Right Leg" or hit.Name == "Right Arm") then BombWeld.C1 = CFrame.new(Vector3.new(-0.5, 0, 0), randLookVec) elseif (hit.Parent.ClassName == "Hat") then BombWeld.C1 = CFrame.new(Vector3.new(0, -0.5*(hit.Size.Y + 0.5), 0), randLookVec) end
myPlayer = game.Players:GetPlayerFromCharacter(myCharacter) tagHumanoid(potentialHumanoid, myPlayer) wait(5) untagHumanoid(potentialHumanoid, myPlayer) end end
connection = NewBomb.Touched:connect(stick)
wait(.1) Force:Remove()
explode() wait(10) script:Remove()
